TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a practising lawyer . He has been a member of the GPE bar since DATE . His office is located in the centre of GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE a Mr GPE lodged a complaint with ORG in GPE . He alleged that DATE , DATE , he had been abducted by several persons working for his former employer , a company called ORG . He had been taken to a certain Mr GPE , an employee of that company , who had threatened him and his family with violence on account of his failure to repay certain money which he owed to the company . He had later been taken to the applicant ’s office , where he had been coerced into signing written promises to pay money , as well as a contract to hand over his car . All these documents had been drafted by the applicant .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the ORG , as in force at the material time , provided that where there existed sufficient grounds to believe that certain premises contained objects or documents which might be relevant to a criminal investigation , the authorities could carry out a search and seizure there .

CARDINAL . According to LAW ORG , as in force at the material time , during the preliminary investigation a search and seizure could be carried out only pursuant to a warrant issued by a judge of the competent firstinstance court . The warrant was issued in ex parte proceedings , without notification or participation of the persons concerned . An exception to the warrant requirement was only possible in exigent circumstances ; in that case the record of the search had to be produced for approval before a judge within twentyfour TIME ( LAW ORG ) .

CARDINAL . As a rule , the search and seizure had to be carried out during DATE and in the presence of the person using the LOC , as well as of CARDINAL certifying witnesses ( Articles CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the ORG ) . The officers carrying out the search could not undertake any actions which were not necessary for the search ( LAW ORG ) .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the ORG , as in force at the material time , provided that witnesses in criminal proceedings had a duty to appear for questioning when called and to remain at the disposal of the authorities until necessary for this purpose .

Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the DATE ORG Caused to LAW ( „ Закон за отговорността на държавата за вреди , причинени на граждани DATE this was the original title ; on DATE it was changed to the ORG and ORG , „ Закон за отговорността на държавата и общините за вреди “ ) , as in force at the material time , provided that the ORG was liable for damage suffered by private persons as a result of unlawful decisions , actions or omissions by civil servants , committed in the course of or in connection with the performance of administrative action . According to ORG caselaw , the actions of the investigation and the prosecution authorities in the context of a criminal investigation do not amount to administrative action and they are therefore not liable under LAW ( реш. № CARDINAL от DATE г. на ORG по гр. д. № CARDINAL г. ; тълк. реш. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL април DATE г. на ORG по PERSON № CARDINAL/CARDINAL г. , ORG ) .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the LAW provides for liability of the investigation and prosecution authorities and the courts in CARDINAL situations : unlawful pretrial detention ; bringing of charges or conviction , if the proceedings have later been abandoned or if the conviction has been overturned ; coercive medical treatment or coercive measures imposed by a court , if its decision has later been quashed as being unlawful ; and serving of a sentence over and above its prescribed duration .
